thread.title: Calipari more worried about energy than offensive efficiency
thread.title_full: Calipari more worried about energy than offensive efficiency

title: Calipari more worried about energy than offensive efficiency
text:
Manage Calipari more worried about energy than offensive efficiency With fans calling for lineup changes, John Calipari said Wednesday night he's more worried about defensive energy than offensive efficiency. Slot to Kentucky Links (Photo: Denny Medley, USA TODAY Sports) 
Despite winning its last five games, it's clear that Kentucky is not playing the kind of basketball it was earlier in the season when the Wildcats got off to a 17-2 start. 
After struggling to beat 7-20 Missouri, who is just 2-13 in league play, on the road Tuesday night, SEC Network analyst and former Wildcat Tony Delk suggested that John Calipari tinker with the UK lineup. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
Delk, who is the school's all-time leader in three-point field goals, says Kentucky needs more shooting on the floor in the form of Mychal Mulder . 
"I like guys who can make shots from the outside. And that would be Mulder," Delk said. "When Mulder comes in, it stretches the floor. You need driving lanes when you're a guard and you need shooters on the outside." 
On his weekly call-in show Wednesday night, Calipari said he's more worried about the other end of the floor. 
"People are worried about [making] shots. I'm worried about energy," Calipari said. "If we're going to make this run, it's going to be with defense. It's got to be about energy." Author
